inn1.comm: around the wicket, length on off stump, punched to short extra-cover
straighter line and punched to short midwicket
forward just outside off and angles it into the gap at point for a quick single
length on off stump, punched from the crease back to the bowler
straighter line and worked out to deep midwicket
leg stump line, swept, it comes off a pad and loops just to the left of slip, tidy start from Root
good length on middle stump, tucked from the crease into midwicket
similar delivery, played back up to the bowler this time
fuller and more leg stump, clipped out through square leg and they run hard for three
full length just outside off and it's pushed very nicely past extra-cover, timed well enough to see it run away to the fence, only just, hardly a rocket outfield
straighter line and just blocked up the wicket
touch shorter and Smith able to get back and tuck it to the right of midwicket for a sharp single
floated a little onto middle and off, blocked coming forward
similar delivery, blocked on the front foot again
played from the crease, gets a leading edge into the covers, there's hestitation and a run out is on at the non-strikers end but Bresnan misfield running in with a run-out at his mercy
back foot punch to extra-cover
big stride forward and a clean strike down the ground, a big hit this, sails into the stands
forward and ran out into the covers, finds the gap for an easy single
back of a length, played with the angle to backward square leg
goes to pull from outside off and gets it badly wrong, missing completely, little full for the stroke
full length at the off stump, played forward and ran to the right of mid-off for a quick single
back of a length ball sliding across the left-hander who lets it come across him and carves it down to third man
full length on off stump, blocked forward back to the bowler
played from the crease and gets an inside edge from off stump to square leg
forward on the stumps, ran to short midwicket
little short outside off, slapped only to cover
flighted and fuller, pushed out into the covers
wider line, ran into the covers but point is up quickly to field
back foot punch back to the bowler's left
stepped back and punched firmly to short extra-cover, a maiden
push forward from off stump to cover
goes to pull and again gets it wrong, gets hit on the thigh pad this time
touch fuller at the stumps, played off the back foot to midwicket
back foot press to mid-on, tight lines again from Broad
goes to turn this to leg but gets struck on the pad, it was sliding down leg and a little high
forward on the stumps, struck on the pad having not got too far out of his ground, loud lbw appeal, not given, replay has it a little high, we do have DRS here but not utilised now
back foot, mistimed push up the wicket, finds the bowler

firm push from just outside off, in the air towards short extra-cover and Jordan dives to his right and takes a blinding catch that is an outstanding grab, an inch above the ground, fabulous reaction to get down so quickly and hold on, pressure does the trick for England
leg slip also goes in, blocked in the crease in front of off stump
blocked in the crease again
touch wider, worked to square leg
back again and blocked in the crease
length ball on off stump, Smith can only stand and block it
pulled and it's third time lucky for Smith, turning this past short long leg off the stumps, a much-needed boundary
fuller at off stump, blocked back up to the bowler
a foot outside off, played at and gets a thick outside edge past slip that races to the fine third man fence, fortunate
leg stump line and whipped out through square leg straight to the deep fielder
full length a foot outside off, left alone
leg stump line, dropped into square leg for a quick single
forward on middle and off, dropped into the covers
full length on the stumps, slapped hard back towards the bowler, Root reaches across to his right and fumbles, allowing them to take two to long-on
fuller and flicked back to the bowler
touch shorter line, blocked in the crease
floated up, a firm punch down to long-on for an easy single
first ball nips back and catches Edwards on the crease, there's a huge appeal for lbw, not out given and England decline a review, it was pad first, that looks very very close on the replay
much fuller and driven pleasantly past mid-on, timed superbly
good length on off stump, punched firmly to cover
dropped into the covers again for no run
full length at the stumps, turned to short midwicket where Root gets down well to save
off stump line and pushed back up towards the bowler
floated up outside leg stump, kicked away, well they're going to get a run behind leg slip
forward on middle and off to defend up the wicket
swept off a big top edge that goes nowhere, lands just inside the 30-yard circle behind square leg

forward on middle and leg, it loops up to where short leg might have been, Buttler runs from behind the stumps and dives forward to take the catch. England are convinced but not out is given, Broad reviews and the replay shows a huge inside edge and the decision is changed. There was a hint of grip that forced the inside edge and Buttler was out smartly to complete the dismissal, big wicket
forward just outside off to block into point
a bit more turn, watched carefully and ran well into the off side
forward just outside off stump to block up the wicket
similar delivery ran back to the bowler
touch straighter line and length to work with too, this is whipped out to long leg, wide of the fielder so they get two

full and straight and bowled him! Off stump knocked back and Edwards goes cheaply. Seemed to just play all around that really, the delivery didn't do much, shaped in a touch but Edwards aiming to leg missed and the ball came off his pad onto the off stump
forward on off stump, pressed up to mid-on
short and pulled off a bottom edge to long leg
forward on leg stump, gets struck on the pad
fuller and driven back to the bowler
shorter and whipped to short midwicket where Bopara gets down to save really well
back on the leg stump and punched back to the bowler
slider across the off stump and beats the bat as he looked to cut
forward on leg stump, stuck on the pad
around the wicket, full and dug out in the leg side
full length, driven with the spin and gets it wide of deep cover
some turn there, punched off the back foot to cover
forward just outside off, ran to backward point
forward on the stumps, ran back up to the bowler
middle and off line, blocked with a forward stride
line just outside off, delicately late cut past short third man
floated up, Simmons takes a stride down the wicket and pads up
tossed up again, blocked off an inside edge to short leg
off stump line, angled from off stump to short third man
skip down the track, just blocked again
backing away, slaps hard to cover
full and defended to the off side
traps this with an inside edge into his pads
drifts onto leg stump, deflects off the pad to short fine leg

first wicket! Moeen strikes, given lbw propping forward on middle and leg. Bravo calls for the review. It was angling towards leg. Did it straighten enough? Looks pretty good, certainly to be clipping and it was out on the field. And it's hitting leg flush! Terrific moment for Moeen
onto the front foot and defends his first ball
comes forward and blocks
onto the back foot and drives to cover
touch fuller, he stretches forward and defends
drops this short and it's a moment of relief for the West Indies as Simmons rocks back and cuts through the off side
loops off the pad to short leg...bat nowhere near
comes forward on leg stump, more turn and it bobbles from bat and pad down by his feet
uses the crease again, steps back towards leg stump but can only find short third man with his late cut
short of a length on off stump, goes back and defends
defended out to midwicket
fuller and angled into the pads, runs into square leg
punched to mid-on
tight line on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
outside off, angling back into the right hander, defended and Bresnan returns with a maiden (the sixth of the innings)
continues round the wicket, played off the back foot to cover
shows some aggression, comes down the pitch and lofts, one bounce, to long on
neat footwork from Bravo who then flicks this through square with his bottom hand
defended off the back foot to mid-off
stretches well forward and whips this through midwicket to the man in the deep
opens the face and defends to short third man
goes onto the back foot, works a straight delivery behind square on the leg side...Jordan does the fielding; he hasn't bowled yet
just a fraction too straight again and this time it's sent to deep square
nips back into him from back of a length, gripping a bit on the surface, takes him high on the back leg
this is quite a full delivery but it's played off the back foot, whipped with a strong bottom hand to mid-on
this is nicely placed, bisects the gap between the two men in the midwicket area
takes a thick inside edge and runs behind square so he keeps the strike
on off stump, defended
opens the face and drives to cover
worked off the back foot into square leg
flicked in the air but it's wide of the short leg
quick single to mid-off as he hits it with just the right power to mean Broad can't cut off the run
defended to midwicket
his line has been immaculate for the most part, this is on off stump and defended
plays this into the off side, short mid-on does the fielding
no width on offer, prodded with caution into the covers
he's 'dotting' them up at the moment, to use player speak, as this one is nudge back down the pitch
is able to rotate the strike this time, opens the face off the back foot and places into between cover and point
pushes this a touch fuller, almost catches him on the crease but a thick inside edge goes through midwicket
tries to use his feet, Tredwell drags the length a little shorter and Bravo can only play it back to the bowler
comes forward this time and defends
played to the off side
flicked in the air down to long on
half an appeal as he prods forward, spins back into him but it was probably a touch high...nicely bowled
pushed out to deep cover
starts full and wide, a rare chance to free the airs and it's driven strongly square through the off side
good delivery, not as full and it nips back into the batsman who defends to mid-off
gets away with this, into the pads and it's deflected to the keeper to makes a good save to his left
adjusts his line, back on middle and off, defended
hops onto the back foot and flicked through square leg...he plays that shot so elegantly
defended back to the bowler
defended to the off side
back to the bowler
nudged into midwicket
a little shorter, gives him the chance to get into the back foot and drive through cover
comes forward and it takes a thick inside past backward short leg, but went to ground first
pushed into the off side for a sharp single...half the overs gone
angled into leg stump, takes the pad (or rather the back of Bravo's knee) towards fine leg...he's in some pain
back on off stump, behind the line and defends
tries to force this off the back foot but it's hard to time and it dribbles to the on side
punched into the pitch and it bounces back to the bowler
takes the pad behind square on the leg side, Jordan appeals but that wasn't hitting another set
good delivery, 136kph/84mph, nips sharply back into the batsman and he jabs down in defence
defended to the off side
tossed up a little fuller, worked down to long on
gets across his stumps and flicks a straight delivery to midwicket
this time he finds midwicket
shuffles down the pitch, keeps it along the deck as he flicks to long on
on off stump, pushed to the covers and there was probably a singe on offer there
flicked from around off stump to midwicket where Root makes the save
some power from Bravo, drilled into the pitch off the back foot and straight back to Jordan
appeal for a catch down the leg side, no wide given so it must have touched pad
in the air! But wide of the bowler. Driven hard off the back foot towards mid-off. Just out of reach of Jordan
across onto off stump and worked to midwicket...it's sometimes looked as though England have had 14 fielders in this innings
a little fuller, shuffles across his crease and defended to short mid-on
slides across outside off, beats the top edge as he tries to glide it through third man
pushed into the off side, the throw is wild but doesn't cost anything
nudged square into the leg side
waits a fraction longer and dabs this square to backward point
defended back to the bowler
forward, defended with bat and pad together
pushed down the leg side and this time it's called wide...first one of the innings
thumped! After all the prodding, Bravo unleashes a wonderful cover drive. A fraction full and wide, he leant back on the strike a little but it raced through the off side.
drags the length back, gets it straighter, defended to short mid-on
on off stump, short-mid-on in action again
this is a good response from Jordan after the boundary, no width on offer, defended back to him
loses his line again, shoved down the leg side, so that doubles the wide tally
full on middle, 138kph/86mph, flicked out through square leg
his eyes lit up at a hint of width, but the lack of pace in the surface means this comes off an inside past the stumps
round the wicket, outside off, comes forward and plays with open face through cover...good running turns it into a brace
too short, cut through backward point for a rare commodity: a boundary
and the man moved, Joe Root, makes the save at square leg
goes down early to paddle the ball, it slides across him and goes underneath the bat
short outside leg, Simmons misses out as he gets taken on the body
defended to the off side
his feet are caught in the crease as he drives a full-length delivery, the ball flies off a thick inside edge through square leg
full on middle and off, driven hard into the pitch and it bounces over Jordan to mid-off
tries to scythe this delivery, which was a touch wider, through the off side but gets a bottom edge into his pads
full at pads, runs into the square-leg area to bring up the fifty stand. It's been hard work, but it's giving West Indies something to work with
nicely played, a punchy back-foot drive as Jordan drops a little short...deep cover runs around
defended to midwicket
goes onto the back foot and flicks behind square leg
played to the off side
nudge into the leg side
defended on the back foot
a little short, gives him time to whip through midwicket and it takes West Indies to three figures
defended to short third man
angled into the pads and it's well put away, glanced fine
corrects his line, outside off, comes forward and defends
now some outright aggression, he comes down the pitch then swings a back-of-a-length delivery through square leg
full outside off, walks into a defensive shot and finds point
gets across his stumps and works with the angle into him from Bresnan, flicked wide of midwicket
a rare bouncer, over middle and off, and it's ruled to be too short...yeah, he needed a ladder to reach that (or to be Joel Garner)
good fielding at backward point by Stokes, it was nicely timed off the back foot
full on off, driven out to deep cover
flicked from off stump towards square leg and he can't find the gap
a smidgen short, Bravo goes onto the back foot and drives to deep cover
fuller again, comes forward and places into point
worked off leg stump to midwicket
this time he places it between midwicket and square leg to the deep sweeper
lovely delivery, just back of a length that slides past the outside edge, angled in towards the off stump
fuller and straighter, clipped out to deep-square leg
some width offered outside off, slapped with decent timing but Broad dives to make a smart save at cover point, saved four
this time finds the gap with a nice back-foot punch, Broad gives chase, tries to dive and flick the ball to Tredwell, he gets it wrong and they can get back for a third
fuller ball outside off, driven hard at extra cover, well saved
back on his stumps, doesn't want to miss that, doesn't and works out to long leg, wide of the fielder so they get a couple
full on off stump, pushed up into the covers for an easy single
touch short, batsman gives himself some room and slaps for four wide of mid-off
similar stroke but mistimed to cover point's left
swept from leg stump to deep-backward square
outside leg stump and a delicate sweep fine of the deep fielder brings Simmons fifty, a controlled innings his side desperately needed, played well, can he go on
another sweep, this time the deep fielder, Tredwell, scrambles well
leg side, swung at and missed
another leg side delivery, just a few times today Jordan has strayed in line
wide delivery outside off this time, cracked for four, poor delivery
gets it right at last and gets pushed to cover
another wide ball outside off, swung at and gets it backward of square to the vacant third man region
tight off stump line, full length, pushed down to long-on
full on off stump, driven to short extra cover, Bopara going to his right to field
full toss on leg stump, could easily have gone for four again, but Simmons can only clip it to deep square leg
good length just outside off, Simmons tamely pushes at it without moving his feet and gets beaten
width offered and this is cracked hard for four over point, hundred partnership comes up, great effort from these two
short but straight and carefully pulled out to deep square leg
back of a length, pulled with a short-arm jab into square leg
full at the off stump, blocked back up to the bowler
length on off stump, pushed to point
back of a length, clipped down to long-on from just outside off
firm punch from just outside off through point, they run hard for a couple
forward and clipped down the ground to long-on
full ball on off stump, finds long-on again

a step to leg and Simmons tries to clear the off side, gets a length ball, a slower ball, high off the bat and it loops to cover and Bresnan takes a big wicket. Simmons was going along nicely and probably didn't need to play that stroke, he's rather handed it away when well set, trying to force the pace, getting into a poor position to have a big swing and being done by a ball Bresnan dragged his fingers across
back of a length on off stump, pushed to midwicket
around the wicket, full onto leg stump, played off an inside edge to square leg
goes to sweep and gets struck on the pad
steps to leg, Root follows him, Bravo sweeps and deep-backward square makes a fine diving save
full on the stumps, tickled too close to midwicket for a single
chucked up outside leg stump, it's flicked fine and it runs away but Bresnan chases hard and keeps them to two, in fact, he's kept them to three! They were considering a fourth
tossed up on leg stump, flicked out through midwicket for an easy single
full delivery just outside off, a lazy drive in the air just evades cover diving to his left
left alone outside off, strikes the pad but it's well outside off
length ball on off stump, Sammy swings hard and whacks it off the toe wide of mid-on, a right old slug but effective
back foot punch to extra cover
full delivery angles in, Sammy squeezes it out through midwicket
full at the leg stump, flicked fine and gets four
forward blocking around off stump
similar delivery, also blocked
back and punched to midwicket
very full, dug out back to the bowler
full on middle and leg, tucked wide of midwicket for a single
bowls a bumper, well-directed, ducked
second bumper, also ducked, also within the limits
fuller but still back of a length, Sammy tries to clear the front leg and hammer it hard down the ground, only finds the bowler
now gets the chance to hammer one way, full on middle and leg and Sammy lifts it up over long-on, huge strike, it sails back, just a clip but he nailed it
goes to pull, gets it wrong and gets hit on the pad that loops back towards the bowler
full and too wide of off stump
even wider!
a third wide! Speared right out in the tramlines again
finally completes the over with a length ball just outside off that is forced off the back foot to deep point
full, driven back to the bowler where Root saves very well
tucked wide of the bowler and this time they get a run
floated up on the stumps, tucked through midwicket and they run hard for two and Bravo brings up a half-century, his work rewarded with a hearty applause
tucked from leg stump backward of square, fielder in too quickly for a run
low full toss clipped out through midwicket
length ball tucked in front of square leg
full length whacked down the ground to long-on
full length just wide of off stump, driven to extra-cover where Broad dives and fumbles, giving up a second run as the ball trundles down to long-off
full and wide of off stump, a big swing gets the toe of the bat and goes miles up over point, Luke Wright charges around from deep cover but can't get there in time
Bravo walked across his off stump, Bresnan followed him outside off but too wide apparently
wanders across to the off side again, Bresnan goes short and gets slapped over square leg, top shot, good cricket
wide outside off again with Bravo taking another step across his stumps, looked harsh that one, the ball went over the bottom third of the bat
another step to the off side, clips a fuller ball down to long-on
big swing from outside off, gets a thick inside edge that flashes down to fine leg, very fortunate or a perfectly executed Chinese cut
slog swept from leg stump and gets it backward of square, four more
full at the stumps, clipped wide of midwicket for a sharp single
full at the stumps, Sammy heaves it down the ground and finds the stands, big strike, elaborate whoosh of the bat having shuffled slightly out of his ground
flatter delivery and Sammy goes flat and wide of long-on this time, another rocketing hit
full ball rolled into midwicket and they go hard for the second with Sammy diving back into the striker's end
Root slides one outside off and gets carved through point, a bridge too far for Root, nice timing there
full and a foot wide of off stump, Bravo throws the kitchen sink at it and gets a wild outside edge that flies past short third man
better line, on the stumps, swung hard again but this is straight to long-on for just a single
another big swing from outside off, gets a thick inside edge that squirts out to deep square leg
full just outside off, driven just to extra-cover
half-volley outside off, swung hard at and gets it over cover, it holds up in the strong breeze and lands short of the rope, they run hard for three
low full toss angled to short third man, they get home for a sharp single as Moeen misses the striker's stumps
steps to leg, Jordan follows him but bowls a low full toss which is steered over extra-cover
better yorker, dug out down the ground and just a single to long-on
back of a length on off stump, a big swing gets a thick top edge that just evades the reach of Buttler, very lucky
low full toss on middle stump, another huge swipe, this one-handed, squirts out through midwicket
no ball, full just outside off and Bravo hammers it over deep point, so much power on the stroke
well bowled, yorker-length on leg stump and Bravo can only punch it back to the bowler
short ball on the stumps that Bravo extraordinarily manages to play with an open face and uppercut it to fine third man, what a shot! Hundred stand is up in no time at all
hard swing to a full ball just outside off, finds long-on
excellent yorker, just a single to long-on again
misses the yorker and Sammy belts the hell out of it down the ground, a huge stroke into the stands, fifty for Sammy
slightly wide, full again, and slapped through cover, excellent timing again
gets this away through cover again, chase back for Wright and they get a couple more
low full toss outside off, a big swing is mistimed and chips it to Broad at cover so England at least end with a wicket but Sammy has played a very nice hand here

inn2.comm: on leg stump, glances off the pad to short fine leg
good delivery, angling across Lumb and it draws him into feeling for it without much footwork...he gets beaten
sprayed wide outside off, called by the umpire...England underway

massive appeal for lbw! Nips back on a good length. Sammy is pleading from second slip. Eventually Bravo calls for a review. Height could be the issue, and where it pitched. Pitches in line but, yes, it's going over. So that's West Indies' reviews done already.
on leg stump again, Lumb can't make contact and it bobbles to short fine leg
full on middle and off, forces himself forward and defends to the on side
full outside off, a good-looking drive from Lumb as he gets a good stride forward but there's a cover sweeper which keeps him to a single
back of a length on off stump, defended to point
short of a length, he goes for the pull but doesn't make clean contact and it bobbles to short fine leg
full on off stump, comes forward and drives to cover where Powell dives to make the stop but can't prevent the single
short of a length, he's on the back foot and shaping for a drive. The ball runs off a thick outside edge down to third man
beaten! Nice delivery, draws Lumb forward but the ball wasn't quite full enough for the drive and nearly finds the edge
defended towards the on side
very wide outside off, so that's an extra run and ball
on the back foot, defends this delivery behind square on the off side
lively! That's a lovely delivery, using his height, the ball is angled across Moeen and bounces awkwardly to climb past the outside edge as Moeen feels for it a touch
defended down in front of gully
frees his arms into a fluid cover drive, was a fuller and wider delivery, and there was a flourish of a follow through
on off stump, defended to the covers
back of a length, neatly punched wide of mid-off
gets across to off stump and defends
beaten as he goes for a booming drive, the delivery was quite wide but not quite full enough
defended to the off side, 135kph/83mph
this time he makes contact with the drive, it goes in the air but wide of cover and has the power to reach the cover boundary
pulls his length back a bit, outside off, left alone
short of a length, Moeen driving off the back foot and it squirts in the air wide of the slips to third man
top shot! Moeen leans into a languid straight drive as Holder overpitches, lovely control and timing in the shot as he takes it from just outside off
and now he pulls, terrific shot, it was that but Moeen picked up the length very early and fetched it from outside off through midwicket
more elegant, classy timing as he drives a back-of-a-length delivery wide of mid-off...superb stuff from Moeen in this over
tries to cut and gets beaten by the bounce
back of a length, defended to the covers
fuller and wider, Lumb drives square of the wicket out to deep point
135kph/84mph, punches it square of the wicket to point
beaten again as he aims a drive through the off side - ball not full enough, and his feet didn't move much
close for a run out! Lumb pulled a length delivery, the ball went to short fine leg and a direct hit would have found Lumb short
his weight is on the back foot as he drives this delivery, which is quite full, and it takes the edge towards Sammy who is stood around fourth slip
beats the edge from short of a length, Moeen keen to continue driving
full at middle and off, pushed firmly to mid-off
there's been a fair bit of playing and missing from Lumb, but he's connected this time as he drives Holder on the up over long on for the first six...powerful stroke
not far away from another boundary, cuts at some width from Holder but point makes a diving save
latches on with the cut this time, goes in the air but clear of any catchers to third man
full on off stump, driven to cover
punched square to point, 139kph/86mph
brings out the pull again, was overly short, doesn't come from the middle and gets a couple wide of mid-on
aims to whip this through the leg side, gets taken on the pad but it pitched outside leg
drops short and Lumb responds with a thumping front-foot pull in front of square...he's growing in confidence
over the leg side again, this time it's full on leg stump and he picks it up off his pads with a bottom-hand flick which beats deep square-leg
waits for this a fraction longer, on off stump, guided to backward point
gets onto the front foot and drives to point this time
driven straight to mid-off but it's deep enough for a single
pushed up to mid-off
gets forward, feels for this slightly as he defends square
driven down the ground to long off
full on middle and off, defended
finds a gap wide of cover as he gets forward and opens the face at he last minute

brings out the slog sweep, he noticed there was no one in the deep, connects pretty well. Goes a long way in the air, but then plugs in the outfield and doesn't make the rope...held up in the breeze, too
worked off his pads to deep square
pushed square of the wicket and the fielders are hanging deep enough for a single
full on middle and off, defended almost dead by his feet and Lumb calls him through for a well-judged single

Big appeal and given lbw! The umpired waited an age. Sounded like he hit it. Lumb reviews straight away. It was a slower ball, off cutter, and there's a massive nick on that. Clear on the front-on view. We don't have Hot Spot in this series, but looks pretty simple and it's overturned
ouch! Takes a blow in a delicate area. Going for a pull and the ball didn't quite bounce, or wasn't as short as expected. He's down. Needs a few deep breath. Physio comes on.
low full toss, aiming for a yorker perhaps, drilled hard into the pitch and back to Rampaul
cut out to deep point
dropped in short, excellent response from Lumb as he upper cuts it wide of third man...it hits the rope on the full so it's a full pint
out to the cover sweeper
defended back to the bowler
a cutter from Bravo, we'll see a lot of these, dropped into the off side
full outside off from round the wicket, driven with an open face to point
finds the outside edge as Moeen pushes away from his body
cut to backward point
strangled appeal for lbw, full on middle, an inside edge saves Lumb again...Narine creating uncertainty
drops short this time, outside off, Lumb cuts behind point
beaten this time as he tries to cut again, skids a touch
through the off side to the point sweeper, the throw comes in and hits the stumps then bounces away for a second run
comes forward, drives with a slightly open face to point
slower ball, outside off, leans forward and defends to cover
strong shot down the ground, whipped with his bottom hand from outside down the on side of the pitch...long-on comes around
short ball, 127kph/79mph, he's been good on the pull and helps this through midwicket although not quite from the middle
another bouncer, over leg stump, Lumb ducks
ah, super shot...short again, outside off, and he upper cuts it very fine past the keeper to third man. Smart batting
full outside off, gets well forward and pushes to backward point
gets away with this! Uses his feet, aims over the leg side, gets a big leading edge which loops down the ground but falls between cover running back and long-off running in
pushed through the off side
takes the pad to the leg side
spins across outside off, left alone
touch short, driven firmly out to deep cover...keeping things ticking
stays round the wicket, Moeen onto the front foot and drives to point
full at the stumps, Moeen flicks through midwicket and places it with a weighting which allows a second
dropped! It would have been a flying effort by Smith at point. Moeen picked up some width with a cut, but didn't keep the ball down and Smith was almost horizontal to his left
lovely stroke, leans into a full delivery and drives through the covers but the sweeper keeps them to a single
just loses his shape a little on this drive, the weight goes backwards instead of forwards, the ball rolls to cover
can't find the gap at point, this time it's a diving stop by Simmons which keeps him to a single from a well-struck drive
length ball just outside off, driven out to deep cover
struck on the pad looking to turn this to leg but well outside off
back and dabbing to point
full on off stump, pushed carefully out to the off side sweeper
full just outside off, Moeen pushes it to cover hanging slightly back in the crease
back to cut, it turns in and beats the inside edge and misses off stump by a whisker, fortunate for Moeen, I don't think he read that!
full and wide of off stump, cut at and gets a thick inside edge that Ramdin reacts to, jumps the opposite direction to which he was initially going and saves with his right hand
around the wicket now, back of a length at the stumps, dabbed into the covers
full at the off stump, driven firmly to extra cover
a flicky back foot stroke that gets a thick outside edge down to third man, wide of the fielder so they got back for a second
full again towards off stump, gently pushed to extra cover
good length and a tight line again, played back up to the bowler
step across the stumps and gets a thick inside edge through square leg
forward on off stump, plays up the wicket
forward and it bounces a little on him and strikes his thigh pad, took a step down the wicket
stays in the crease now and blocks around off stump, very unsure here Moeen
now he slashes a fuller ball on off stump and gets a thick outside edge to point
gets this through the infield and two runs out to the sweeper running to his right
a charge down the wicket, Sammy bangs it in, Lumb flays at it and gets a thick outside edge fine of third man
Ramdin now up to the stumps, full length blocked back to the bowler
slower ball outside off, Lumb chips it but finds the gap at cover
full delivery towards off stump, pressed to extra cover
slightly short and a short-arm jab down to long-on
straighter line and whipped out to deep midwicket
length ball just outside off, chopped down to third man and that's Lumb's fifty, a nice innings on ODI debut
full length on off stump, dug out to mid-on

length ball on off stump and Moeen has chipped it to long-on. A rather unnecessary stroke really, I think he was trying to find the gap over midwicket but got it wrong, it carried very comfortably to the deep fielder
full length just outside off, driven at and missed, it goes past everything and runs away for four, must have been some bottom edge to get it under Ramdin's gloves
similar delivery, a touch wider and played out to deep cover
a cutter, very full and Wright misses trying to drive it outside off
length on the stumps, tucked down the ground to long-on for an easy single
full at the stumps, flicked to midwicket
a foot outside off, slapped to cover, mistiming it
punching off the back foot finds midwicket
forward on off stump to play with the angle up on the leg side
full just outside off, driven firmly to extra cover
length at the stumps, flicked wide of short long leg for an easy single
some width just outside off, slapped on the bounce to backward point
pulled off a thick top edge and it loops into a gap just over square leg, very lucky
full at the off stump, gentle chip down the ground for a couple out towards long-off
full and driven back to the bowler
tries to angle it away on the off side and gets a thick inside edge to square leg

back of a length and pulled straight to midwicket and that ends a not very impressive nine-ball stay where Wright didn't time one ball. He tried to pull this away but the delivery was on him too quickly and he got it high on the bat and straight to midwicket for the simplest of catches
back of a length just outside off, defended going back on his stumps
fuller on a similar line, blocked in the crease again
full length at the off stump, blocked in the crease
slightly straighter line, worked to midwicket
back foot, pushing in front of midwicket and they take a quick single
short outside off, pulled into midwicket
full at the stumps, flicked wide of midwicket out to the deep
full length just outside off, played to cover
fuller and finds cover point this time
shorter ball, Lumb gets across his stumps and works this into the on side, the bowler gives chase and prevents two
length ball a foot outside off, guided down to third man
Root comes down the wicket, the bowler drops this shorter and Root flicks it down to long leg
length ball angled in, squeezed out towards point
touch of width, punched out off the back foot to deep cover, the fielder simply runs past it and they get a second
hint of width and chopped down to third man
full length at the stumps, punched down to long-on
full length at the stumps again, flicked down to long-on again
back of a length, turned to short long leg with the angle
length ball a foot outside off, cut at and missed
straighter line, flicked out to deep midwicket
very full and dug out into the covers
similar delivery, forced back up the wicket again
straighter line and whipped out to deep midwicket for an easy run
back of a length and forced out through point, they run hard and get back for the second
a flick in the air but just short of midwicket who then has the chance to throw out Root at the non-striker's end, he misses, where was Root going!
but this is good running, a firm punch wide of deep cover for a couple
turned from middle and leg wide of short long leg for an easy single
full but gets the line wrong and Root flicks it fine but long leg chases really well and get a big boot out to save four
slower ball on off stump, dropped not far enough away from point for a single
excellent yorker on off stump, dug out into the covers
swung slightly across the line but it was always going down leg as Lumb is struck on the pad
cut, mistimed and finds cover
cut again and this time finds the gap, well timed but it was aerial for a long time
tighter line and angled to backward point
full length on off stump, Root works this well past midwicket and gets two as the deep fielders comes a long way to his left
back of a length just outside off stump, forced to long-off
touch short and Root is quickly back to pull to deep square
back of a length and pushed out gently to deep cover, wide of the fielder for an easy two
this is too wide and Lumb is able to reach across and steer it wide of third man, nice controlled stroke
full straight delivery, driven firmly back to the bowler
slower ball on leg stump whipped out to the deep fielder
lovely stroke, back of a length only slightly outside off and Lumb hangs back and guides this fine of short third man, lovely control
cutter ends up being a low full toss but Lumb can only find cover
full just outside off, flicked down to long-on
short at the body but pulled only to long leg, bit of a freebie from Smith
yorker length, Lumb tries to angle it away but gets an edge into Ramdin's ankle, it rebounds to short long leg
full on the stumps, easily flicked out to deep midwicket
full at the pads, cry for lbw, it was going down with the angle, ball cannons down to third man
touch short and easily pulled out to deep square leg
off stump on a length, Lumb tries to stay inside it and angle down to third man, gets a bottom edge that runs towards point  and they steal a single
length on off stump and easily worked out to deep midwicket, too many easy runs available
another simple couple with a little push in the gap wide of the sweeper
length ball just outside off, pushed firmly to deep cover
full just outside off, driven to cover
slower straighter ball, worked into midwicket for an easy run
stays around to Root who pushes a low full toss down to long-off
goes to cut just outside off and misses
nice slower ball that has Lumb groping just outside off and missing
another cutter, this is pushed firmly to extra-cover on the front foot
full length from just outside off, pushed down to long-on
back of a length wide of off stump, cut very firmly but Smith at backward point can only parry it, poor work, only a single conceded though
back on his stumps, guides a full ball to short third man
fuller ball, Root was looking to work to leg but got a big thick edge that looped only just over cover, very lucky
back of a length and turned down to long-on, easy runs
back of a length, pushed firmly to the long-on man again
back of a length, worked down to long leg
full length on the stumps, turned into square leg and they take a flashing single
slower ball at the leg stump, flicked slowly to midwicket
short down the leg side, pulled and missed, that was miles down leg, brief cry for caught behind but that ball did not deserve a wicket that's for sure
slower ball on leg stump, rolled back towards the bowler
similar delivery, this time Root picks it and steers a flick wide of long-on for an easy couple
length on off stump, Root leans forward and drops this into the covers
full length just outside off, driven out to deep cover
forward just outside off, pushed back up the wicket
back of a length pulled hard, deep square does well coming to his left and saves two

back of a length just outside off, steered wide of cover for a quick single and that's Lumb's century! What a fabulous effort, a hundred on ODI debut just the second man after Dennis Amiss to do that for England
full just outside off, pushed firmly to cover
length delivery just outside off, driven off a bottom edge back to the bowler
almost a catch straight, he chips a full delivery down the ground but fortunately for Lumb it landed short of long-off
round the wicket, full outside off, driven into the covers where there's a diving save but he can't stop the single
goes in the air over cover this time, not perfectly timed, and it plugs in the outfield
very full, dug out to point...Root was racing up for the single but was sent back just in time
full outside off, goes up and over the off side again and again it stops in the outfield...safe shot once it clears the ring
slower ball outside off, 105kph/65mph, pushed firmly to point
dabbed square into the off side
over the wicket, full, driven to mid-off
outside leg stump, he aims to work it off his pads and gets a leading edge back over the bowler's head...another cutter slower ball
goes for the pull, can only find midwicket
shapes into Root from a full length, worked down the ground to long on
there's the breakthrough! He advances down the pitch, it's a short of a length delivery, he drives to drive it over cover but can only pick out the fielder
finds a leading edge straight away, a full delivery which Root tried to work through the leg side
beaten! Extra bounce this time, goes over the top edge as he tries to cut. Knuckle ball
gets across the stumps, turns it to short fine-leg and Stokes calls for the sharp run
this one spins back into the left hander, cramps him for room as he plays to the off side
more turn, takes him on the pads, bobbles wide of slip
some aggression as he goes down for the slog sweep, fetches it from outside off and sends it over straight midwicket
that helps for England! Picks up a length delivery outside off and lofts it over midwicket, one bounce over the rope
a touch fuller this time, opens the face and finds short third man
shuffles towards leg to create some room, but then just taps a full delivery into the covers
short on leg stump, not a great delivery, pulled away behind square
down the leg side, poor ball...Stokes doesn't connect with his shovel/pull but England get an extra ball
short on leg stump again, pulled to deep square
excellent yorker, Root does well to dig it out
pushed to backward point

and another! Or so it seems. Narine appears to have bowled him as he went for the sweep. Stokes isn't sure, thinks it may have come off the keeper. We'll see in a moment as the umpires check. Yep, that's just clipped leg stump
beaten first ball! And Bravo is excited about an edge. It's not out. Buttler fiddling outside off to one that spun away
onto the back foot, worked to the leg side
full on middle, tapped back down the pitch
close! Appeal for lbw. This was the offspinner, Buttler lunged forward and was taken on the pad. Turned too much.
worked away from outside off into the leg side...Root wanted a second but deep midwicket was quickly off the boundary
comes forward, pushed to the off side
worked off the stumps down to long on
good piece of timing, and it's misfield on the deep square-leg boundary by Dwayne Smith...strong flicked off his pads, but it should have been two at most
and this one is heading his way, again, and this time he keeps them to a single
low full toss which is flicked down the ground
pushed off the back foot to point...not sure Buttler picks him at all
prodding forward with no certainty, rolls towards slip off a thick edge
ah, well, he's played this pretty well! Brings out the reverse sweep and sends it rocketing through point. Rolled his wrists very nicely
big turn! Spins down the leg side, Ramdin can't take it
he's on a roll! Root goes for the sweep, the ball loops off the glove and gives the keeper a simple catch
beats him! Lovely delivery, grips and does just enough to beat the outside. Nervy
short outside off, slapped to cover
very full, dug out through midwicket and with the lack of pace to allow a second
tries to force it through the off side but he's cramped for room
ugly delivery, low full toss on leg stump, so two is not a bad result for West Indies as Buttler flicks to deep square-leg
low full toss again, aiming for the yorker, and another sprinted couple made by Buttler's insistence
that really changes things! West Indies favourites now. Buttler trying to clear the off side, it was a slower ball, rolls his fingers across it, there's no timing in the shot and it lobs to mid-off
beaten as he tries to cut his first ball
worked off the back towards mid-on
sharp spin into Bopara who traps it between bat and pad
very full and he can only dig it out back to the bowler
full outside off, driven hard into the ground and stopped with a dive at cover. Crowd catch.
worked into the leg side...just two from the over. England suffocating.
full on leg stump, clipped to deep square
slower ball outside off, dropped square towards point
fired down the leg side, a little bonus for England
driven to the left of mid-off
107kph/66mph, tucked into midwicket
full at the stumps, hint of shape into him, driven up to mid-off
touch more bounce this time, Bresnan takes his bottom hand off the bat as he turns it through square leg
bounce for Narine, beats Bresnan over the top edge
comes forward and prods the leg side, Narine moves across to field and makes a direct hit but Bresnan is safe
goes onto the back foot, it's a shorter delivery and he guides it out to deep point
speared down the leg side
ooh, called wide again. Outside off this time. May have been harsh. Very tight call. Bresnan missed his cut
a ripper! Bresnan had no idea. Spins away from short of a length and beats him all ends up
and again! Wonderful stuff from Narine. Bresnan hasn't got a clue as he fiddles at it while standing on leg stump
well, that's a bonus for England as Narine loses his line onto leg stump and Bresnan tickles him very fine
full on middle and off, blocked to the covers. Priceless dot.
good delivery, very full, only bunted towards mid-off
superbly bowled, a slower ball and Bresnan was about a day early on his attempt to pull
makes contract, heaves it from outside off but only finds deep square-leg
slower ball outside off, Bopara fetches it through midwicket and places it for a couple
driven very powerful back at Bravo who takes most of the pace off it in his follow through
that was there to put away, length angling into the pad but Bopara misses out
he fluffs this into the leg side, heaving across the line, and long-on can't stop two
uses his feet, but it's fired it at his toes and he can only clip to deep square
short of a length, at the body, bobbles very close to the stumps but Bopara calls him through...mighty close to the woodwork as it flicked the flap of the pad
deceived by a slower ball, was shaping for a big blow over the leg side but was through his shot and the ball just dribbles to the on side
short, down the leg side
and another wide, Bresnan shuffled across his crease and perhaps that put Rampaul off...the ball slipped down leg
walks way outside leg, the ball follows him and he pulls to deep midwicket
terrific delivery, full outside off, Bresnan jabs over the top of it
low full toss, he swings hard but can only find long on
this one is out of the middle, drilled down to long on where Simmons does well to knock the ball back in before he steps over the boundary...sharp work
a length ball, but only costs a single down to the busy Simmons
yorker, at leg stump, doesn't go further than the fielding circle. Yorkers still work. Who'd have thought
low full toss, Bopara gets plenty of height on this straight down the ground...falls between two fielders
well, he goes back of a length and beats him as he tries to heave to leg side
connects with fresh air again, fuller delivery and it scoots past leg stump. They run a bye to the keeper. That's fine for West Indies.
pulled into the leg side, deep square leg gets around the boundary
angling into the pads, flicked away and for all the world it appeared to have split deep square and fine leg but it's another excellent flick-back on the boundary...Powell this time
down the track, head in the air, heave to leg. Misses.
dragged down short, pulled out to deep midwicket...all done and dusted
